intro: Chisocheton cauliflorus, commonly known as the red-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are borne on the trunk and branches, a characteristic known as cauliflory. This unique floral display makes it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
